result: {"ok": true, "results": [{"id": 284917, "informal_statement": "For any type \\(\\iota\\) and a family of sets \\(f : \\iota \\to \\mathcal{P}(\\alpha)\\) in a topological space \\(\\alpha\\) that is also an Alexandrov discrete space, show that the complement of the closure of the union of the family is equal to the union of the complements of the closures of the sets in the family, i.e., \\((\\overline{\\bigcup_{i} f(i)})^c = \\bigcup_{i} (\\overline{f(i)})^c\\).", "formal_statement": "import Ma

args.query: mathlib4 intersection of topologies inf TopologicalSpace instances intersection family TopologicalSpace.mk infimum topology

args.content:
import Mathlib

universe u v

variable {X : Type u} {ι : Sort v} (T : ι → TopologicalSpace X)

/-- Given a family `T` of topologies on `X`, there exists a unique largest topology on `X`
    contained in all the topologies `T i`. -/
theorem exists_unique_largest_topology_contained_in_family :
  ∃! (S : TopologicalSpace X),
    (∀ s : Set X, @IsOpen X S s → ∀ i, @IsOpen X (T i) s) ∧
    (∀ S', (∀ s : Set X, @IsOpen X S' s → ∀ i, @IsOpen X (T i) s) → ∀ s, @IsOpen X S' s → @IsOpen X S s) := by
  sorry
